intro: Codonoboea lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific growing conditions to flourish.
